thig5.3:1.1: “Not applying the mind to see the origin of things,
thig5.3:1.2: I was afflicted with longing to gratify the senses.
thig5.3:1.4: and I had no power over the mind.
thig5.3:2.4: I could not attain tranquility of mind.
thig5.3:3.3: never finding happiness by day or by night,
thig5.3:4.3: Better for me to be strangled here
thig5.3:4.4: than to go back to the inferior life.
thig5.3:5.2: and hung it from the branch of a tree.
thig5.3:5.3: As soon as I placed the noose around my neck
